page.title: 10HOUSING
page.content: Freiston has stayed very much as an old village with only some council houses being built in recent years, as it is in a green belt. Butterwick and Fishtoft have changed quite a lot with a great deal of private housing having been built in recent years. People have tended to move out of Boston to these houses. In Fishtoft many of the new roads have interesting names. Scotia Road commemorates the now disappeared Scotia Creek where the original Pilgrim Fathers were arrested in 1607. Marshall Close commemorated a former Chairman of the Parish Council and school Goveror, whilst Rimington Road commemorates Mr. Rimington who was Headmaster of the school for 20 years and his daughter who was Head for 30 years.
